bug.author: CESARDELATORRE
bug.summary: Need to document value "-1" for max_cores_per_iteration. Not mentioned in the reference doc.
bug.description:
In the REMARKS sample aboove and also in some notebooks we have it with max_cores_per_iteration = -1. I think that means "use all the possible cores per iteration/child-run". However, the "-1" value is not documented in this reference doc page. We need to document it. Right now the description of the parameter is just this (check above in this page): max_cores_per_iteration int Maximum number of threads to use for a given training iteration. This should be less than or equal to the maximum number of cores on the compute target. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: 0bc2b21e-6b1a-cb94-2857-147177a29d7c Version Independent ID: d14620a6-a2f6-49f1-632e-73903d41de8c Content: azureml.train.automl.automlconfig.AutoMLConfig class - Azure Machine Learning Python Content Source: AzureML-Docset/stable/docs-ref-autogen/azureml-train-automl-client/azureml.train.automl.automlconfig.AutoMLConfig.yml Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @j-martens Microsoft Alias: jmartens

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/CESARDELATORRE>@CESARDELATORRE</denchmark-link> Thanks for the feedback. We are investigating the issue and will update you shortly.
Change was made and will go live with next SDK release. Thanks.
